intro: Centaurea biebersteinii subsp. rhodopaea, commonly known as the Rhodope centaury, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native range.
